definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known

sentences.english: The conference will focus on how to prevent the spread of AIDs throughout the world.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议将重点解决如何防止爱滋病在全世界传布。

sentences.english: The news of victory spread quickly.
sentences.chinese: 胜利的消息很快传布开来。

sentences.english: Cluster is a ubiquitous phenomenon in mass media industry.
sentences.chinese: 大寡化现象反在儿同信做传布业外未普遍亡反在。

sentences.english: Province of left and right sides of completely state-owned at that time half alleges want project of semiconductor of mount a horse.
sentences.chinese: 那时全国有一半摆布省份传布宣扬要上马半导体项目。

sentences.english: This new program will make a major step forward in the spreading the Olympic ideals.
sentences.chinese: 这项新计划将在传布奥林匹克理想迈出重大的一步。

sentences.english: These words will go forth to the world when our bones are dust.
sentences.chinese: 这些祂的字语在我们骨头成灰时，亦将传布到世界上。

sentences.english: Seeking evidence of effective dissemination of the quality policy by appropriate communication.
sentences.chinese: 通过适当的沟通方式来寻求传布质量方针的客观证据。

definition: to lecture on doctrine/to expound the wisdom of ancient sages/to preach/a sermon
to proclaim/to make public or well known
to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
